<text text-anchor="start" x="46" y="-1630.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Okay so I'm going to start off the discussion,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="50" y="-1615.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> but all of you have your questions with you</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="42.5" y="-1570.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> actively listening to our um to our classmates.</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="52" y="-1555.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Right, s-, we don't want to repeat the same</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="48.5" y="-1510.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> going to start out with, well discuss this and</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38" y="-1495.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> then we'll move on to your questions, is, "What</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="46" y="-1480.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> is the effect of beginning the novel with Ivan</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="70" y="-1450.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> begining the novel with the funeral?</text>

<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="12393,-1610 12393,-1637 12704,-1637 12704,-1610 12393,-1610"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="12484" y="-1619.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 57 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="12393,-1478 12393,-1610 12704,-1610 12704,-1478 12393,-1478"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="12413" y="-1592.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Okay good so you said a lot of things there. You</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="12399" y="-1577.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> made some comment about the upper class. And how</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="12412.5" y="-1562.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> about, how the upper class is selfish and how the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="12426.5" y="-1547.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> upper class doesn't want to die. Right, that's</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="12437" y="-1532.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> all good. How about, can you make any</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="12420" y="-1517.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> connections to Tolstoy the author? Remember</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="12414.5" y="-1502.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> from the powerpoint? How did he feel about the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="12425.5" y="-1487.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> upper class versus the peasant class? St. 12?</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="12392,-1610 12392,-1610 12705,-1610 12705,-1610 12392,-1610"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="12391.5,-1477.5 12391.5,-1638.5 12704.5,-1638.5 12704.5,-1477.5 12391.5,-1477.5"/>
</g>
<!-- 58 -->
<g id="node109" class="node"><title>58</title>
<polygon fill="tomato" stroke="none" points="13933,-1580 13933,-1622 14216,-1622 14216,-1580 13933,-1580"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14002" y="-1604.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 58 - STUDENT 12</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14058.5" y="-1589.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">NEW</text>
<polygon fill="tomato" stroke="none" points="13933,-1493 13933,-1580 14216,-1580 14216,-1493 13933,-1493"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13948" y="-1562.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> He found that the uh upper class couldn't find</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13960" y="-1547.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> the true meaning of life and that even for</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13953" y="-1532.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> himself, he said he didn't find a meaningful</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13939" y="-1517.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> life until he was a peasant and he could work for</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14042" y="-1502.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> something.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="13932,-1580 13932,-1580 14217,-1580 14217,-1580 13932,-1580"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="13931.5,-1492.5 13931.5,-1623.5 14216.5,-1623.5 14216.5,-1492.5 13931.5,-1492.5"/>
</g>

<text text-anchor="start" x="13693" y="-1657.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 61 - TEACHER</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="13634.5" y="-1630.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Pure' is a good word, yea. Morally superior,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13645.5" y="-1615.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> they lived a morally superior lifestyle in</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13624" y="-1600.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> comparison to those of the upper class. So, here</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13628" y="-1585.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> we are in chapter one, already seeing Tolstoy's</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13637" y="-1570.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> attiude about the Russian upper class of the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13628" y="-1555.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> 1800's, about how he feels about them. About,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13634" y="-1540.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> bless you, how they're selfish, how they feel</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13628" y="-1525.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> about death, how they treat one another, right?</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13642" y="-1510.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think that's pretty significant and I think</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13634" y="-1495.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> through all of this, his end goal, as we'll talk</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13630.5" y="-1480.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> about as we continue to, to read, is what St. 5</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13629.5" y="-1465.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> said, through all of this, his goal is to teach us</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13688" y="-1450.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> that big theme which is?</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="13617,-1648 13617,-1648 13898,-1648 13898,-1648 13617,-1648"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="13616.5,-1440 13616.5,-1676 13897.5,-1676 13897.5,-1440 13616.5,-1440"/>
</g>

<text text-anchor="start" x="13100" y="-1555.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Mmhmm. What did he say about the people of the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13120" y="-1540.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> lower class? What kind of lifestyle did they</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="15019.5" y="-1589.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 65 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="14944,-1508 14944,-1580 15224,-1580 15224,-1508 14944,-1508"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14962" y="-1562.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I love, I love your question! I love this part.</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14950" y="-1547.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> What do you guys think about that? What, what</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14960" y="-1532.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> were you thinking in your mind when you're</text>

<polygon fill="white" stroke="none" points="14609,-1565 14609,-1607 14908,-1607 14908,-1565 14609,-1565"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14686" y="-1589.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 64 - STUDENT 19</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="14615" y="-1547.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> When he walks into the room of, of Ivan Ilyich and</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14618" y="-1532.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> why is it hard for him to decide whether to bow or</text>

<!-- 63 -->
<g id="node116" class="node"><title>63</title>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="14276,-1693 14276,-1720 14572,-1720 14572,-1693 14276,-1693"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14359.5" y="-1702.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 63 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="14276,-1396 14276,-1693 14572,-1693 14572,-1396 14276,-1396"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14287" y="-1675.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> What? {"How to live.", St. 12} How to live very</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14285.5" y="-1660.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> good. How to live. Let's get some more questions</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14282" y="-1645.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> from you guys. And when we have our discussions</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14307.5" y="-1630.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> guys, I want you to think, think a little bit</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14297.5" y="-1615.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> deeper than just the comprehension. I already</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14315.5" y="-1600.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> assume that you've read it and that you</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14309.5" y="-1585.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> understand the book let's talk about, like,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14299" y="-1570.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> some of those bigger philosophical questions</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14291.5" y="-1555.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> about life and death and how to live and how to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14317.5" y="-1540.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> treat death. Let's try to think that way,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14292.5" y="-1525.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> because this is our opportunity to examine how</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14282.5" y="-1510.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> we live our lives and how we look at death. This is</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14297.5" y="-1495.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> our opportunity, we're looking at death subje-</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14335" y="-1480.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I'm sorry, objectively instead of</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14326" y="-1465.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> objectively. We're looking at death</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14307" y="-1450.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> objectively without any emotion attached,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14305" y="-1435.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> this is our chance to examine our lives and</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14291.5" y="-1420.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> potentially our own deaths someday long, long,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14340.5" y="-1405.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> long, in the far future. St. 19?</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="14275,-1693 14275,-1693 14573,-1693 14573,-1693 14275,-1693"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="14275,-1395 14275,-1721 14573,-1721 14573,-1395 14275,-1395"/>
</g>

<polygon fill="tomato" stroke="none" points="15779,-1618 15779,-1660 16053,-1660 16053,-1618 15779,-1618"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="15843.5" y="-1642.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 66 - STUDENT 11</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="15900" y="-1627.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">NEW</text>
<polygon fill="tomato" stroke="none" points="15779,-1456 15779,-1618 16053,-1618 16053,-1456 15779,-1456"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="15792.5" y="-1600.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Um, like, when he, like, ... like, approached</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="15789" y="-1585.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> his coffin, I think that's what it was, um, like,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="15785" y="-1570.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> he didn't really know what to do, because, like,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="15794" y="-1555.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> he didn't kow, like, whether to, like, respect</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="15804.5" y="-1540.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> him or, like, to hate him. Because, like,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="15804.5" y="-1525.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> they're all talking about, like, how, like,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="15801" y="-1510.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> they didn't really like him so, like, in this</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="15790.5" y="-1495.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> manner, he did die, and, like, so he thinks he</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="15803" y="-1480.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> should respect him but, like, he still has,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="15839" y="-1465.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> like, so much hate for him.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="15778,-1618 15778,-1618 16054,-1618 16054,-1618 15778,-1618"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="15778,-1455 15778,-1661 16054,-1661 16054,-1455 15778,-1455"/>
</g>

<text text-anchor="start" x="17936" y="-1555.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Are these thoughts crossing your mind? So, how</text>

<!-- 101 -->
<g id="node164" class="node"><title>101</title>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="25073,-1708 25073,-1735 25367,-1735 25367,-1708 25073,-1708"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25152" y="-1717.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 101 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="25073,-1381 25073,-1708 25367,-1708 25367,-1381 25073,-1381"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25101.5" y="-1690.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Yes, fake. {some laughter from class} So,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25096.5" y="-1675.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> everybody, like, I know it sounds funny, but</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25098" y="-1660.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> ingrain that word into your memory for this</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25101" y="-1645.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> book, because that's what these people are.</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25099.5" y="-1630.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> These people are fake. They only do things</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25095" y="-1615.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> because society says that they should. Okay?</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25093.5" y="-1600.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> They only do things because society says that</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25080.5" y="-1585.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> they should. Why did Ivan Ilych get married? Did</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25090.5" y="-1570.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> he love her? Did we read that chapter yet? Oh,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25089.5" y="-1555.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> it's not two yet? Anybody read ahead? No? So,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25099" y="-1540.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> you'll find, when you read the next chapter,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25084.5" y="-1525.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> that he didn't marry her because he loved her, he</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25108.5" y="-1510.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> married her because society said that he</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25104" y="-1495.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> should. And Peter Ivanovich isn't worried</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25102.5" y="-1480.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> about the sadness he's feeling because he's</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25100" y="-1465.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> lost his best friend, he's only worried about</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25079" y="-1450.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> what society says that he should do when he walks</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25107.5" y="-1435.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> up to the coffin. So, think about author's</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25087.5" y="-1420.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> purpose and what Tolstoy's trying to prove with</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25092" y="-1405.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> this kind of behavior. St. 19, does that answer</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="25177.5" y="-1390.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> your question?</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="25072,-1708 25072,-1708 25368,-1708 25368,-1708 25072,-1708"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="25072,-1380 25072,-1736 25368,-1736 25368,-1380 25072,-1380"/>
</g>

<text text-anchor="start" x="38921" y="-1562.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Um it says uh, "He screamed for three days</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="38906" y="-1532.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I don't know how I bore through it all. You could</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38910.5" y="-1517.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> hear him three rooms away. Oh, what I've been</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="39015" y="-1502.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> through."</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="38899,-1580 38899,-1580 39187,-1580 39187,-1580 38899,-1580"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="38899,-1492.5 38899,-1623.5 39187,-1623.5 39187,-1492.5 38899,-1492.5"/>

<text text-anchor="start" x="38108.5" y="-1664.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 153 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="38032,-1433 38032,-1655 38321,-1655 38321,-1433 38032,-1433"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38046" y="-1637.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Okay, so, pretty painful. Yea, alright now, you</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38053.5" y="-1622.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> guys can think of the worst pain you've ever</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38046" y="-1607.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> imagined, which I'm thinking, breaking a bone</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38051" y="-1592.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> might be that, I'm not sure, um but this guy's</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38038.5" y="-1577.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> probably in so much pain and I think maybe it's a</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38040" y="-1562.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> combination of pain and denial at the same time,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38044.5" y="-1547.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> it's so much pain that he screams for three days</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38056" y="-1532.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> straight. So, take your worst pain and think</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38038" y="-1517.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> about how miserable he must have been. Can you</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38044" y="-1502.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> picture that? Pretty awfu? And now, what is the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38047.5" y="-1487.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> satire that Tolstoy uses there? Go to that page,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38041" y="-1472.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> see if you can figure out what the satire is. What</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38051.5" y="-1457.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> is satire by the way? You all defined it at the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="38138.5" y="-1442.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> start of class.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="38031,-1655 38031,-1655 38322,-1655 38322,-1655 38031,-1655"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="38030.5,-1432.5 38030.5,-1683.5 38321.5,-1683.5 38321.5,-1432.5 38030.5,-1432.5"/>
</g>

<text text-anchor="start" x="37519" y="-1585.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Okay, so ,I think that's a really important part</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="37526.5" y="-1570.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> of the text. Um he screamed for three days</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="37517" y="-1540.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> a bone here? Okay, did you scream? Anybody</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="37523.5" y="-1525.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> scream? I've never broken a bone so, I don't</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="37503" y="-1510.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> know. Okay, St. 19, you screamed. What bone was</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="37637" y="-1495.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> it?</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="39753.5" y="-1585.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Um so, this is the wife talking and she's saying</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="39758.5" y="-1555.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> um putting it as that he was in pain, she's sad</text>

<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="40880,-1640 40880,-1667 41174,-1667 41174,-1640 40880,-1640"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="40959" y="-1649.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 163 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="40880,-1448 40880,-1640 41174,-1640 41174,-1448 40880,-1448"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="40887.5" y="-1622.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> The wife right? The widow! Sorry, um yes, this is</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="40899" y="-1607.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> the widow, right? She should be like, "Oh my</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="40895.5" y="-1592.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> gosh! My poor husband!" But instead she says,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="40886" y="-1577.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> "Oh it was awful, I don't know how I bore through</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="40889" y="-1562.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> it all! It was so hard on me! It was unbearable for</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="40900.5" y="-1547.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> me to stand the pain he was facing!" Are you</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="40887" y="-1532.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> kidding! So, how many people laughed when they</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="40899" y="-1517.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> read that part? You should've laughed, and it's</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="40903" y="-1502.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> okay now that you know, if you didn't, that's</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="40887.5" y="-1487.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> okay, but now that you know, you should laugh at</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="40908" y="-1472.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> these people when they say things like this</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="40904" y="-1457.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> okay? Because why? Why is it funny? Yea?</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="40879,-1640 40879,-1640 41175,-1640 41175,-1640 40879,-1640"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="40879,-1447.5 40879,-1668.5 41175,-1668.5 41175,-1447.5 40879,-1447.5"/>
</g>

<text text-anchor="start" x="42428" y="-1555.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> She's acting almost like it's a person that she,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42442" y="-1540.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> like, almost hated. She didn't like them.</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42429.5" y="-1525.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> {laughter from Teacher} {"That's true too.",</text>

<!-- 171 -->
<g id="node222" class="node"><title>171</title>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="42091,-1670 42091,-1697 42385,-1697 42385,-1670 42091,-1670"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42170" y="-1679.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 171 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="42091,-1418 42091,-1670 42385,-1670 42385,-1418 42091,-1418"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42119.5" y="-1652.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Yea. Do you sort of look at this and say to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42104" y="-1637.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> yourself, "Wow, these people are clueless. Why</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42114.5" y="-1622.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> are they so, so silly, so oblivious?" Are you,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42107.5" y="-1607.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> are you kinda looking at them, like, "Duh, you</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42097" y="-1592.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> should know better than to behave that way." How</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42111" y="-1577.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> many people are thinking that in their minds?</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42150.5" y="-1562.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Like, she's definitely not acting</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42108" y="-1547.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> appropriately. Okay, and I think Tolstoy wants</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42118.5" y="-1532.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> those things, that you kind of giggle at like</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42111.5" y="-1517.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> that, I think he wants those things to stick out</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42105" y="-1502.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> like a sore thumb to you. This is your chance to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42114.5" y="-1487.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> stop and examine your life and ask yourself,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42102.5" y="-1472.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> "Would I ever do anything like that? I'm not this</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42119.5" y="-1457.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> selfish, am I?" And I think that's really his</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42105" y="-1442.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> goal. When you see them do things like this, he</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42099.5" y="-1427.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> wants you to stop and look at your own life. Yea?</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="42090,-1670 42090,-1670 42386,-1670 42386,-1670 42090,-1670"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="42090,-1417.5 42090,-1698.5 42386,-1698.5 42386,-1417.5 42090,-1417.5"/>
</g>

<text text-anchor="start" x="43461.5" y="-1612.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 172 - STUDENT 19</text>

<polygon fill="tomato" stroke="none" points="43391,-1486 43391,-1588 43684,-1588 43684,-1486 43391,-1486"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="43397" y="-1570.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Uh I found another example, when the widow was</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="43407" y="-1555.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> being selfish. When she was just talking to um</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="43409.5" y="-1540.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Peter about the money that she could possibly</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="43401.5" y="-1525.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> get, from the government, she wanted more than</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="43400.5" y="-1510.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> what she was given. And she actually cried when</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="43420" y="-1495.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> she figured out that she couldn't get more.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="43390,-1588 43390,-1588 43685,-1588 43685,-1588 43390,-1588"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="43389.5,-1485 43389.5,-1631 43684.5,-1631 43684.5,-1485 43389.5,-1485"/>
</g>

<g id="node226" class="node"><title>175</title>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="43078,-1610 43078,-1637 43355,-1637 43355,-1610 43078,-1610"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="43148.5" y="-1619.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 175 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="43078,-1478 43078,-1610 43355,-1610 43355,-1478 43078,-1478"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="43091" y="-1592.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Absolutely. Absolutely! You kinda can't help</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="43087" y="-1577.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> but laugh at these people, right? Tolstoy wants</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="43093" y="-1562.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> you to stop and ask yourself, "Do I have my</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="43112" y="-1547.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> priorities in line? Am I living my life</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="43103" y="-1532.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> correctly? I don't behave like this, do I?"</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="43084" y="-1517.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Cause this obviously is not the right way to live</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="43089" y="-1502.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> according to Tolstoy, and I think we probably</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="43168" y="-1487.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> know that. St. 8?</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="43077,-1610 43077,-1610 43356,-1610 43356,-1610 43077,-1610"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="43076.5,-1477.5 43076.5,-1638.5 43355.5,-1638.5 43355.5,-1477.5 43076.5,-1477.5"/>
</g>

<text text-anchor="start" x="42825" y="-1604.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 173 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="42745,-1493 42745,-1595 43041,-1595 43041,-1493 42745,-1493"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42763.5" y="-1577.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> {laughter from Teacher} Yeah, I mean, when,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42768.5" y="-1562.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> when she's crying about her husband's death,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42777" y="-1547.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> she is easily able to control herself, right?</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42757" y="-1532.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> But then, later on when we find that she can't get</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42772" y="-1517.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> anymore money, that she's really sad right?</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="42751" y="-1502.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> What else is funny about that situation? Mmhmm?</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="42744,-1595 42744,-1595 43042,-1595 43042,-1595 42744,-1595"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="42744,-1492.5 42744,-1623.5 43042,-1623.5 43042,-1492.5 42744,-1492.5"/>
</g>

<text text-anchor="start" x="45970" y="-1555.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think that another example would be that, on</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="45967.5" y="-1540.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> page 36, it says, "There is, in fact, no reason to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="45961" y="-1525.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> assume this incident can keep us from spending a</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="46046.5" y="-1510.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> pleasant evening."</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="46002" y="-1208.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> So, just basically, people are um not thinking</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="46011" y="-1193.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> of his death they are just feeling the effect</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="45356" y="-1223.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Is this the time and place to be asking about</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="45346" y="-1208.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> money? No. This absolutely is not the time and</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="45340" y="-1193.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> place to be asking about money. What would you</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="45341.5" y="-1178.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> expect, what would you expect commonly in this</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="44685" y="-1268.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Yea, let's go out and play cards. Let's go out and</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="44690.5" y="-1238.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> here so we can play cards." Meanwhile, this is</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="44699.5" y="-1223.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> supposed to be their friend, their colleague,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="44681.5" y="-1208.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> right? Let's go back to the idea of the widow. The</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="44696.5" y="-1193.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> widow is talking to Peter Ivanovich. "Hey is</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="44672" y="-1178.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> there any way where I can get some more money out</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="44685" y="-1163.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> of the government from this? Like, now that my</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="44690.5" y="-1148.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> husband's dead, can I get some more money?"</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="44699.5" y="-1133.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Right? So, that part is funny but what else?</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="44723.5" y="-1118.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Where are they right now? St. 17?</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="47839" y="-1555.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Just so they could feel um more acceptance for xx</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="47493" y="-1592.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Um so going back to the game of bridge uh so, it</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="47505" y="-1577.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> says that Peter sat through the service and he</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="47503" y="-1562.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> was one of the first people to leave to then go</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="47508" y="-1547.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> play with Schwartz, uh playing bridges. So,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="47500.5" y="-1532.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> obviously this is one of the hyporitical uh cues</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="47496" y="-1517.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> of how the author portrays uh um, like, Peter ad</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="47511" y="-1502.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> his other close friends. So, my question is,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="47487" y="-1487.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> "How would you prove your friendship to someone</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="47587.5" y="-1472.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> if they [died]."</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="47480,-1610 47480,-1610 47780,-1610 47780,-1610 47480,-1610"/>

<text text-anchor="start" x="47049.5" y="-1672.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 189 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="46973,-1426 46973,-1663 47262,-1663 47262,-1426 46973,-1426"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="46988" y="-1645.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Okay. .. I think that we just expect a whole lot</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="46979" y="-1630.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> more grief and how about kindness for the widow</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="46985" y="-1615.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> or for the children? Like, "I'm so sorry for your</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="46995.5" y="-1600.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> loss." Those sorts of comments. I think that</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="46981.5" y="-1585.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> might be more of what we'd expect in a situation</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="46988" y="-1570.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> like this but we really don't see that from thsse</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="46988.5" y="-1555.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> characters. And in chapter one, Tolstoy does a</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="46989.5" y="-1540.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> really good job of character development, and</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="46994" y="-1525.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> you start to learn about these characters, and</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="46979.5" y="-1510.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> what kind of people they are. And that's gonna be</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="46994" y="-1495.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> important to our understanding of the rest of</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="47000" y="-1480.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> the text. Alright, let's do another question.</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="46998" y="-1465.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Or if it's not on your list and it's something</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="47005" y="-1450.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> that is, like, a burning question, for you,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="47052.5" y="-1435.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> let's do it. Okay, St. 2?</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="46972,-1663 46972,-1663 47263,-1663 47263,-1663 46972,-1663"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="46971.5,-1425 46971.5,-1691 47262.5,-1691 47262.5,-1425 46971.5,-1425"/>
</g>
